title: Where the Wild Things Were: Life, Death, and Ecological Wreckage in a Land of Vanishing Predators
description: For years, predators like snow leopards and white-tipped sharks have been disappearing from the top of the food chain, largely as a result of human action. Science journalist Will Stolzenburg reveals why and how their absence upsets the delicate balance of the world's environment.
author: William Stolzenburg
